TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LoginViewDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control renders one of its templates, determined by whether a user is logged on to the host Web site, and the roles that contain the logged-on user account.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> methods return the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control at design time. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when the current template is not defined. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method returns a serialized copy of the current template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method sets a region of the associated control from a serialized copy of a control template.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method is called when there is a change to the associated control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove properties from, add additional properties to, or shadow properties of the associated control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class to change the appearance and behavior of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyLoginView` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView>. The `MyLoginView` is a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control. The example also derives the `MyLoginViewDesigner` class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class and applies a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute for the `MyLoginViewDesigner` on the `MyLoginView` control.
The `MyLoginViewDesigner` control overrides the following <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> members:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to make the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.NamingContainer%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to draw an orange border around the control to make its extent more visible.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup for a placeholder that includes the error message, which is rendered in red, bold text.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup for a placeholder that contains the names of the role groups that are defined for the control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method to throw an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception, if the associated control is not a `MyLoginView` object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/CS/LoginViewDesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/VB/LoginViewDesigner.vb#1)]

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ActionLists As DesignerActionListCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class, adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> that is obtained from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> base property, and then returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection>.

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A string containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method sets the template index of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to the current design-time index, and then causes the associated control to recreate and data bind its child controls, if necessary. Next, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method to generate the markup.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> class at design time. The example draws an orange border around the control to make its extent more visible.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/CS/LoginViewDesigner.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/VB/LoginViewDesigner.vb#4)]

block.para: If you override the method, be sure to call the base method because it eventually, through several override levels, calls on the control or a copy of the control to generate the markup.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml (regions As DesignerRegionCollection) As String

Docs.param: A to which definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the are added.
Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.
Docs.returns: A string containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method creates an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> object for a template editing area on the visual designer surface, and then initializes it as a template. If no templates are defined, a string is displayed that prompts you to click to begin editing. A predefined constant is used to generate the returned markup.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> class at design time. The example draws an orange border around the control to make its extent more visible.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/CS/LoginViewDesigner.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/VB/LoginViewDesigner.vb#4)]

block.para: This overload does not call on its base method or the control to generate the markup.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetEditableDesignerRegionContent (region As EditableDesignerRegion) As String

Docs.param: The for which to obtain content.
Docs.summary: Returns a serialized copy of the current template that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A string containing a serialized copy of the template used to render the associated at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a template implementing the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITemplate> interface can be obtained from the `region` parameter, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method returns the persisted template. Otherwise, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> base method to generate the content.
The serialized template can be restored to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when the current template is not defined.
Docs.returns: A string containing markup text that renders to a placeholder on the design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method first formats a string message that specifies the name of the current template of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control and also specifies that the template is empty. Then the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> generates the markup for a placeholder containing that message.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> class at design time. The example generates the markup for a placeholder that includes the names of all the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> objects that are defined for the associated control.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/CS/LoginViewDesigner.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/VB/LoginViewDesigner.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetErrorDesignTimeHtml (e As Exception) As String

Docs.summary: Provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
Docs.returns: A string that contains the markup used to render the associated at design time after an error has occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The error design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control renders as a panel that contains the type name, the control name, and messages announcing and describing the error.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> class at design time. The example generates the markup for a placeholder that includes the error message, which is rendered in red, bold text.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/CS/LoginViewDesigner.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/VB/LoginViewDesigner.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Initialize (component As IComponent)

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The visual designer calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class to change the behavior of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> class at design time. The example throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException>, if the associated control is not a `MyLoginView` object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/CS/LoginViewDesigner.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/VB/LoginViewDesigner.vb#6)]

Docs.exception: is not a or of a class derived from .

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnComponentChanged (object sender, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs e);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnComponentChanged(object sender, class System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs e) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub OnComponentChanged (sender As Object, e As ComponentChangedEventArgs)
public: override void OnComponentChanged(System::Object ^ sender, System::ComponentModel::Design::ComponentChangedEventArgs ^ e);

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Called when there is a change to the control that is associated with this designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method is called when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control executes. Typically, this is in response to a property change on the control (for example, a **Properties** grid change). If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control template is changed, the **Properties** grid is refreshed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> verifies that the current template index is valid, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> base method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub PreFilterProperties (properties As IDictionary)

Docs.param: A collection implementing the of the added or shadowed properties.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove properties from or add properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method applies the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.RoleGroups%2A> property so that it does not appear in the **Properties** grid.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner> class to change the **Properties** grid of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> class at design time. The example makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.NamingContainer%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/CS/LoginViewDesigner.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner/VB/LoginViewDesigner.vb#3)]

block.para: Override the method to add properties to, remove properties from, or change attributes of properties in the design-time property collection. Be sure to call the base method before performing other processing.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (region As EditableDesignerRegion, content As String)
public: override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(System::Web::UI::Design::EditableDesignerRegion ^ region, System::String ^ content);

Docs.param: An that provides the name of the region to update.
A string that contains a serialized template for the associated control.
Docs.summary: Sets a region of the associated control from a serialized copy of a control template.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method parses a serialized template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control that is specified by the `content` parameter, and then uses the template to update the region of the control that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerObject.Name%2A> property of the `region` parameter.
The current template of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control can be serialized using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property TemplateGroups As TemplateGroupCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.
Docs.value: A containing an element for each template in the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property gets a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> base property, and then adds <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects that contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for the anonymous template (which corresponds to no user logged on), for the logged-on template, and for each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> element in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.RoleGroups%2A> collection of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection>. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> returns this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> to the caller.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property UsePreviewControl As Boolean
protected: virtual property bool UsePreviewControl { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property creates the copy by persisting the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control, then parsing the persisted control string. The copied control does not affect any persistence for the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView>.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.

block.para: You can override the property to return or to determine its value based on whether the control is marked with a class level attribute. If the is not overridden, the ignores the .
